intro: Horkelia daucifolia, commonly known as the Sierra dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in mountainous regions. It has a taproot system and produces small, oval seeds that are dispersed by wind. Horkelia daucifolia is often found in open habitats such as meadows and slopes.
